intro: Racosperma phlebopetalum, commonly known as the broad-leaved acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and is often found in dry, open habitats. It plays an important ecological role by fixing nitrogen in the soil, contributing to nutrient cycling in its environment.
